title: Textile, 18th–19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: background fabric: plain weave with contiuous supplementary wefts.
Inset: 7&1 harness satin with brocading wefts.
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 284 x 56 cm (9 ft. 3 13/16 in. x 22 1/16 in.)
description: Panel of red, yellow and white woven silk with inset panel of pale tones showing a woman with a basket of flowers. The inset panel is earlier than the background fabric. Panel was used as a wall covering. There are still traces of glue on the back.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 18th–19th century.
18th–19th century. Medium: silk
Technique: background fabric: plain weave with contiuous supplementary wefts.
Inset: 7&1 harness satin with brocading wefts.. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-335.
